Reviews.Title: Great camera, so-so bundle
Reviews.Author: J. P. LEVICK
Reviews.Content: I just received this package yesterday, so this review is preliminary and may be revised in the future.  FWIW, I am not a professional photographer, but I have extensive 35mm experience and was a "semi-pro" with 35mm work.  This is my first DSLR, though I've shot thousands of photos with "super zoom" digitals.  My 35mm work was almost all with Minolta and Olympus cameras, and I've never previously owned a Canon, other than a digital point-and-shoot.It is obvious at the outset that the 7D is an awesome camera.  Its features are all I could want, and while I've still got a learning curve, and will have one for awhile, it seems to be very user-friendly.  Layout of the controls is excellent for me, and their use seems pretty intuitive.  It's a bit heavy, but given its capabilities, not so much.  The included lenses seem really light in comparison to the body.  I like the overall feel, and the few shots I've taken so far are incredibly sharp.  "Motor drive" speed is amazingly fast.I bought this kit because the price was exceedingly attractive, and had no particular expectations as to quality of lenses and accessories.  Since the whole kit is priced less than is the bare camera body from many sources, I figured that I couldn't go wrong.  The included lenses mostly cover the waterfront as far as my shooting needs in terms of focal lengths, and the kit is cheap enough that I figured that if a lens doesn't cut it, I can sell it and get a better one.  Time will tell.Instructions are good, but not great.  Better than most, however. The included software installed effortlessly on both my home and office computers, glitch-free.  Camera setup was easy, though it seemed to take forever to charge the battery initially.The 18-55mm lens seems sharp, though I'd like it to be a bit faster/brighter.  Time will tell if I want to keep it.  Right now, a Tamron 17-50mm f 2.8 is looking appealing as a replacement, as are several lenses in the 15-135mm range.  Construction of the 18-55 looks and feels cheap, but I'm used to heavy-duty 35mm lenses, so I may be prejudiced.  It does autofocus very quickly.The 50mm f 1.8 Canon lens feels really light and cheap, but looks bright through the viewfinder.  I see a f1.4 or f1.2 replacement in the future, but not anytime soon.  Most of the time, I get along fine with f4 and slower lenses.  This lens will only see limited, low-light use, anyway.The 75-300 mm lens looks and feels good, and I'm really looking forward to wringing it out.  I do a fair amount of wildlife photography, as well as semi-long-distance pictures of grandkids playing sports, and I have high hopes for this lens for those purposes.The Vivitar flash is much cheaper and less powerful than this camera deserves, though it beats the built-in flash by a wide margin.  I'll likely keep it, but will almost certainly want a much more powerful Canon EX model in the future.The Vivitar 2X teleconverter and Zeikos 0.45X WA converter are, well, cheap items which may or may not ever get used, given the loss of speed accompanying their use.  "Kit syndrome," I call them.  I'd have gladly traded them both for a better flash unit, made by Canon, in the kit.The little filter kit is nice but not extensive enough, the tripod is lightweight and a bit flimsy, and the rest of the "extras" are just okay.  The sling bag camera case is sturdy and seems well-constructed, but is not very user-friendly in terms of lens and accessory storage.  The nylon bag that is made for just the camera is quite handy and well-made, but its mothball smell is overpowering.  Hopefully, that will fade over time.Overall, I feel good about the purchase.  I look forward to shooting a few thousand pictures and getting back to this review, but I do have great expectations.Quick addendum:  Yesterday afternoon, I had time to shoot a few pics with the 75-300mm lens, and I am quite pleased.  Beautiful detail, sharpness and color accuracy and saturation, throughout the zoom range, on near and far subjects.  No vignetting visible to my tired, old eyes.  Autofocus is FAST.  I need to do some more formal testing, but for the nonce, I'm happy with this lens.  This morning, I noticed something annoying about the Zeikos sling bag: It is left-handed, made to be slung over the right shoulder.  Since I'm right-handed, it's going to be mostly useless to me, except for protecting lenses and flashes.  Not a huge deal, but irritating.  Also, the little 3-compartment Zeikos carrier for cards is too small for the big CF cards the 7D uses.  Also just an annoyance, but still...Okay, I've now used the camera to shoot my son's wedding rehearsal and wedding, along with a bunch of grandkid pictures and a few other things.  Mostly, I've used the 18-55mm lens, and results have been quite satisfactory, but not overly impressive.  I've ordered both a Canon 15-85mm EF and a Tamron 17-50mm f2.8 to use as alternating "walking around" lenses.  For a kit lens, the 18-55 is not bad, but this fantastic camera deserves better.The Vivitar flash is disappointing.  I've also ordered a Canon 580EX flash, and the Vivitar will only serve as a backup or as a slave.  It seems that the ETTL function is hit-or-miss with the Vivitar, and with its low guide number, its output is not a great deal more than that of the built-in flash.  It does recycle quickly, however.As I learn more about the camera itself, I just keep liking it more and more; incredible machine!  However, even at the low price point of this kit, I think I'd have been better off buying the body separately, and then adding lenses that do the jobs I need done.  No complaints about the 75-300mm, however.  I've not used it a lot, but I continue to be impressed with it when I do.

Reviews.Title: Worthless package
Reviews.Author: B. Singh "Bari"
Reviews.Content: I bought this package expecting it to be good value, if not excellent. Total disappointmentThe only thing worth keeping in this package is the camera body itself. Rest seems to be just CHEAP fillers to make it a big package. I wish I would have just bought the body and then I could have bought rest of the stuff on my own. Still would have been able to manage in the same price, if not better. With better products.The 2 stars are just for the camera body.Would never buy again.

Reviews.Title: I got what I paid for. Exactly what I expected on the package items
Reviews.Author: maplhgr
Reviews.Content: I bought this based on price with no unrealistic expectations that the additional items in the kit were going to be the best around. If you want the best price for the camera body and some decent lenses this is the place. I expected going in that I would want a better tripod and flash. I researched the item offered and knew what I was getting. The camera is great and yes I can buy better lenses but they are all fine for my needs as I once again get as serious about photography as I was many decades ago before raising a family. I will upgrade as I can and until then I will not be disappointed.For those that bought the kit thinking that all the amenities were going to be top notch I can only say to do your homework before spending your money. You can buy oats after they have been thru the horse much cheaper but you should know what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: Canon 7D
Reviews.Author: Stokee
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is my first one on my quest to be a professional photographer. There price was good and included so many accessories.  Everything was packaged well and no damage to any of the contents.

Reviews.Title: canon EOS 7D Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Fuller "bblical searcher"
Reviews.Content: The camera is everything I expected it to be. It is  easy to handle and very portable. The lenses are simple to exchange.  The company selling the camera offered excellent assistance in correcting an order error I made.

Reviews.Title: Quality is not good
Reviews.Author: wassem
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in march and i like the camera, but i don't like the other staff such as the bag and every thing that come with the purchase. Also, all the items has a very low quality. However, for me it was a good thing because i am a beginner and i need to use every thing to know wither i need to buy the original one or not. Notice That The Memory Cared In The description  is 16GB, but it was not 16GB it was 8GB with the label of 16GB. The last thing you will receive your canon as a body only wish will not has the original bag from canon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera....
Reviews.Author: Vinod
Reviews.Content: What  can i say about canon 7D, it has all the featues loaded in one camera and even a common man can easily handle it,takes great pictues with great quality.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but accessories are quite cheap!
Reviews.Author: Myliga
Reviews.Content: I really like to have my 7d. It is a great camera and the only lens I really like from this package is 50mm. The package included everything they promised except that for some reason instead of receiving canon battery with the camera, they sent me a cheap one. So I call them right the way and they sent me the new canon battery for free and I still kept the other one.Their costumer service is amazing!Would definitely buy again from Big Mike Electronics! Ps: just make sure you check everything before pass too many days :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: tsmith
Reviews.Content: Camera, telephoto and 18-55 lens make this package. Backpack is left handed which works for me but may be ackward for right handed people. Also, it opens on the side to access the len compartment which means you have to lay it down to open it safely. 50mm fixed lens is what the filters in the package fit. The other attachments and extras are nothing to get excited about. The tripod is really light weight but flimsy feeling. The flash is basic, the other camera pack is just big enough to hold 3 pair of gym socks or your 58mm filters for all the other lenses and the misc small stuff in the package.

Reviews.Title: Camera Body and 3 Canon Lenses Alone are Worth it
Reviews.Author: Fred Hutto
Reviews.Content: I bought this package knowing that the residual items (non-Canon) were going to be cheaply made. The price of the package was worth the Canon 7d body and the 3 Canon lenses alone.The two bags were smaller. the tripod was not worth the metal it was made with. It was very flimsy and it quickly went into the trash. Of course I knew that when I bought it. The non-Canon wide angle lenses seem to be of god quality, but they are not the best ever. The flash is poor quality, again not worth the material it was made with.Overall I like the camera and the lenses and that is what I needed. The other stuff is expendable.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, cheap tripod
Reviews.Author: Jorge Ortega
Reviews.Content: The camera and the lenses are awesome as will as the filters, but what we didnt like were the tripods,specially the big one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but late delivery and problem on sensor??? or memory card???
Reviews.Author: Young Kim
Reviews.Content: I liked camera and all but I am noticing green pixel on post... I am trying to fix it but if I can't I'll send it back...Also you guys delivered memory card pretty late(and it's cheap one)

Reviews.Title: Just above satisfaction
Reviews.Author: Kaushik
Reviews.Content: Its a Good Deal. Just have a feeling on the additional filters quality. Overall this bundle is just above satisfaction

Reviews.Title: I like it but got a problem in less than 8 months
Reviews.Author: Ahmed
Reviews.Content: almost 8 months then i got a message error that the memory card cannot be accessed. Moreover, the serial number on the cam different that the one in the invoice.That problem happen when I recording in Video Mode,  because the CF card was not matching the speed of the camera. Once I changed the CF card it work again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome deal!
Reviews.Author: Mrig
Reviews.Content: The camera exceeded my expectation. And I was just lucky enough to get this deal on time. Recommended product. If you are first time SLR buyer, this deal has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: come as described and do perfectly the work
Reviews.Author: Nia K.
Reviews.Content: come as described and do perfectly the work. ship fast and come as described with a lot of accessories. like it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Kit for hobby level
Reviews.Author: Neivas
Reviews.Content: I've had a small problem with the purchase because it has 1 lens missing, but I've just sent an e-mail through Amazon and everything was solved very quick. The missing lens was delivered in no time.Good job Big Mike Electronics!!!So the kit is ok, but some of the itens are cheap, in quality I mean.Everything is working ok, but the specifications should show more details including the brands of all the itens.But I'm happy anyway, and recomend it for hobbysts, if you are a pro consumer, try other ways.

Reviews.Title: Only OK Package deal.
Reviews.Author: Huong Doan
Reviews.Content: I must be frank, the cost for this camera is a good deal (body only).  The three lenses are Canon's lowest quality and will be replaced soon but they are as described.  The bags are ok and do protect the camera.  The other lenses only screw on the Canon lenses and I have not needed to use them yet.  They seem OK.  The tripod is fine for the cost and holds the camera steady.  The extra flash does not seem any better that the built in flash.  The other items are what you would expect.  Now I get to the CF Card.  Do Not Use! I took over 700 pictures on the camera with this card.  Every once and a while the camera could not play back an image. (around 5 pictures that I remember), but when I went to load them into the computer (Mac) the computer said there were no files.  I put the card back into the camera and the camera said no images.  All the photos were lost.  I have purchased a ScanDisk card and have not had any issues.  Again the price on the camera and three Canon lenses is worth the price the other items are ok except the CF card.

Reviews.Title: Good combo
Reviews.Author: Adrian
Reviews.Content: Too much body and cheap accesories. Lens can be better, but is ok. The flash works fine but isn't a speedlite.

Reviews.Title: Great Experience
Reviews.Author: Tony Donald
Reviews.Content: I must say I am very pleased with Big Mikes (sender) package kit and the service. Their was a  small problem with the shipper and they took care of it right away.

Reviews.Title: Excellant value
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Great camera at a great value. I bought this as a christmas present for my wife and she is totally excited about it. The price i paid on Amazon saved me several hundred dollars. The package arrived on time and with no problems with the contents. Camera and lenses were of a great quality, however the accessories and the bag were of somewhat cheap constuction but i still paid less that what a local store was asking for camera body only unit.
